articleName: From Urban Science to data storytelling: Inside the work of Kelsey Nanan
quote1: The joy Kelsey infuses into her own work keeps audiences engaged
quote2: In [Kelsey's] view, every interaction should spark curiosity rather than feel like a chore
quote3: In data viz development, anything you can imagine, you can create
quote4: One of Kelsey’s core philosophies is to let the data speak and shape the story, rather than forcing a predetermined narrative.
quote5: ...data isn’t just numbers — it’s stories, people, and possibilities waiting to unfold

articleName: Building better together: Collaborating beyond the role
quote1: When everyone goes just a little bit beyond what their role may traditionally call for, we unlock a lot of potential
quote2: ...shoutout to those examples and articles we as developers always reference. I don’t know these people personally from my team, but sometimes I feel like I do
quote3: The beauty of the early deploy and live link is that the project then becomes real for everyone, allowing for very useful feedback at every point
quote4: When we figure out how to use these tools with non-developers, we can save a lot of time and effort on our parts
quote5: Sometimes as developers, we almost have tunnel vision about how a design should be implemented

articleName: The Tortured Data Viz Department: An Analysis of Taylor Swift’s Lyrics
publishedIn: Nightingale (Journal of the Data Visualization Society)
quote1: Wanting to focus on anything but the discomfort of my pain, my clumsy leg brace, and my inability to move, these songs provided a much-needed escape
quote2: I consider this the grown-up version of doodling Taylor Swift lyrics in my notebook margins in school
quote3: “research,” as I told my boyfriend, who remained unamused every time I’d walk around the apartment singing “I love you, it’s ruining my life!”
quote4: The price of fame is far from a novel theme in art and poetry, but I was pleasantly surprised at the clever take in The Prophecy.
quote5: Of course, the phrase “get you back” can mean either “win your love again” or “get revenge on you”–a cheeky narrator never lets us know which it is.

quote1: I think life is all about finding the next great dance
quote2: I'd love to create a tool that explors clusters of related [yoga] poses
quote3: Here's a bar chart showing a snapshot of my current snacking supplies
quote4: I'm interested in the idea of a visualization that inspires physical movement
quote5: I'd opt to not look at a computer screen for most of the day

articleName: A Decade Wrapped: Plotting nostalgia for a Data Viz Gift
quote1: These dates, easily plucked from my photo collection, became not only data points but also meaningful stops down memory lane
quote2: from a distance, the final graphic resembled a whimsical, scribbled note–a nod to my boyfriend’s vocation as a writer
quote3: Categorizing and contextualizing old memories can be a touching journey
quote4: Let data visualization transcend the realms of dashboards and scrollytelling
quote5: if you’re a regular reader of Nightingale like I am, chances are that your love language is data, too

articleName: The Best Day... To Buy a Taylor Swift Ticket
quote1: Looking back on it now, I realize (as ridiculous as it sounds) that I passed through something like the five phases of grief in my search for Taylor Swift tickets.
quote2: I...then wrote Python code that grabbed the day’s data from SeatGeek and wrote it to a Github repository (thanks ChatGPT!).
quote3: What happened next is what I would consider a developer’s dream–the first version of the viz became (more or less) the final version.
quote4: It’s me, hi, I’m the user it’s me!
quote5: As she traversed the eras of her career, so I traversed the eras of my life.
